channel.title: Latest Random JavaScript Tips
channel.description: Doc JavaScript's Tip of the Day Archive
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2006 Jupitermedia Corporation. All rights reserved.

item.title: Suppressing Errors
item.description: Do you want to avoid having JavaScript errors displayed? Learn how to use onerror to suppress them.

item.title: Supporting the document Object
item.description: Is the document object a regular node on the DOM tree? Well, it depends on the browser. Internet Explorer 6 supports it to the fullest.

item.title: Which Frame was Clicked?
item.description: How do you detect which frame has been clicked? Here's one way to do it.

item.title: Rotating Text Banners
item.description: Do you know how to update existing text? Learn how to create rotating banners.

item.title: Writing the Hello World's ASP.NET Page
item.description: Do you know how to write the Hello World's ASP.NET page? Learn how to establish the relation with the Code Behind JScript .NET file.

item.title: IBuySpy's OrdersDB Component
item.description: Do you know how many classes there are in IBuySpy's OrdersDB.js? Learn about this JScript .NET component's classes, methods, and properties.

item.title: Understanding Abstract Classes
item.description: Can you tell an interface from an abstract class? Learn about the differences and similarities between them.

item.title: Absolute Elements
item.description: Do you know the difference between "static" and "absolute" positioning? Learn how to define absolute elements.

item.title: Opening Applications from JavaScript
item.description: Do you know how to open a Word document from JavaScript? Learn how to use the ActiveXObject.

item.title: WML's Events
item.description: Do you know how to use WML's event handlers? Learn how to implement a help card with WMLScript.

item.title: The SqlParameter Class
item.description: Do you know how to send and retrieve parameters to and from a stored procedure? Learn about the role and responsibilities of the SqlParameter class.

item.title: Introducing ASP.NET
item.description: Do you know what ASP.NET is? Learn what it is used for and what the similarities to HTML are.

item.title: Creating Error Messages
item.description: Remember how difficult (and boring) it was to clean up error messages? Learn how to avoid the mess entirely in JavaScript.

item.title: DOM vs. DOMDocument
item.description: Do you know what the relationship between the DOM and the DOMDocument is? Learn how the DOMDocument extends the DOM by 21 properties, 10 methods, and 3 events.

item.title: Creating New Attributes
item.description: Do you know if it's possible to create attributes on the fly? Yes and no. Yes on Netscape 6, no on Internet Explorer.
